BEAN.Definition: a seed or pod containing seeds that comes from a plant

SPIRITUAL.Definition: relating to deep, often religious, feelings

CENTREPIECE.Definition: the most important part of something

POD.Definition: a long, narrow part of a plant containing beans and/or seeds

PODS.Definition: the long, narrow parts of a plant containing beans and/or seeds

PULP.Definition: the soft, inside part of a fruit or vegetable

BEANS.Definition: seeds or pods containing seeds that come from a plant

FERMENT.Definition: goes through a chemical change, because of an active organism that exists inside

CRUSHED.Definition: pressed hard so that it breaks

MAIZE.Definition: a tall plant with yellow seeds, which when harvested is called 'corn'

NO OBJECT.Definition: if something is no object, it doesn't matter

PRESERVE.Definition: if something is the preserve of a group, it is only available to them

IN SCARCE SUPPLY.Definition: if something is in scarce supply, it is very rare

PLANTATIONS.Definition: large farms, often in hot parts of the world, where a particular plant is grown

SHADE.Definition: the darkness caused when something blocks the light from the sun

APHRODISIAC.Definition: something used to increase sexual desire

PRESS.Definition: a machine that puts a lot of weight on something in order to change it

POWDER.Definition: a dry substance made up of tiny solid pieces

PATENTED.Definition: if something is patented, only the holder of the 'patent' has the legal right to produce it

PATENT.Definition: a legal document that means only you can produce something

SNACK.Definition: a small amount of food eaten between meals

BOOM.Definition: a period of increased economic activity

BILLBOARDS.Definition: the large boards on which adverts are shown

FLIP SIDE.Definition: the opposite, less good aspect of something

COMMODITIES.Definition: a good that can be bought and sold

TRADING HOUSES.Definition: companies that buy and sell products

FUTURES.Definition: agreements to buy or sell a product in the future

HARVESTS.Definition: the time of year when crops are cut and collected

BETS.Definition: bets in order to make money

IRONY.Definition: a situation which is funny or strange because something unexpected happens

INJUSTICE.Definition: something that is not fair or right

SPECULATING.Definition: betting on the future price of something
